3. Privacy controls: Users can control their privacy settings by adjusting who can see their tweets, direct messages and lists of followers and followings.

4. Data retention policy: Twitter has a data retention policy that outlines the length of time it retains certain types of information, such as tweets, direct messages, etc.

5. Transparency: Twitter provides transparency to users by disclosing its privacy policies, terms of service and other relevant information on its website.
